intro: Cyathella bojeriana, commonly known as the Bojer's Cyathella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny stems, which help it conserve water in its harsh habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the tips of the stems. Cyathella bojeriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
